Posts.Content:
Hi Guys, as you can see from my signature, I'm normally posting in the Prostate Cancer forum, but just thought I would pop in a pay a visit.
I'm seeking help for a friend of mine whom has just been diagnosed with
Breast Cancer. She is 43 years of age, very Thin and not a big eater.
All I know at this stage is she has had her operation to remove a small lump in the breast. Turns out the small lump felt from the outside, was actually quite large inside. Doctors have told her she will need to have
her breast removed and a full hysterectomy. She will also require chemo at some stage, she has been told.
Is it possible to tell me what stage she is from this information, and her
future outlook. I would like to be a little more informed before approaching her.
Many Thanks Kev.
Kev 54yrs [Gold Coast Qld, Australia]
PSA 4 Gleason 7 [4+3]
RP 24/12/08 Dr Philip Stricker [Sydney]
Stage 2 Tumor 7% Margin status- Focal Involvement
Fully Cont. ED- 90%
PSA @ 3yrs <0.01
"Every-day in Every-way I Get Better"
Posts.Title: Help Please
